name: Coffee Break Dance Quiz / Test | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: The first two will be multiple choice to get you started. Soft _____ opera.
questions.explanation:
soap.

	Soap operas were called that because the accompanying ads sold soap products. To soft soap someone is I believe the same as buttering someone up.

towel.

	Do you towel dry or air dry?

questions.text: Type in the correct word. Apple _____ ball.
questions.explanation:
butter.

	Apple butter is cooked-down apples made into a spread.

roller.

	I think roller rinks still exist, but they are for people on rollerblades, yes?

leaf.

	The Canadian flag has a red maple leaf on it. I hate leaf blowers. Too NOISY!

rug.

	Snug as a bug in a rug. Pioneer women used to make rugs from old rags. Some people still do, I suppose. I think rugrat is a vulgar term for a baby.

Christmas.

	I live in California, so I've had few white Christmasses.

green.

	Greenpeace is that Save the Whales organization.

screen.

	I'm ready for my close-up, Mr. De Mille.

black.

	A bootblack shines boots and shoes. During the 1950s blacklisted Hollywood actors, directors, and writers branded as Communists couldn't get work.

tape.

	Scotch tape is a trademark of the 3M Corporation. A tape worm can live in an animal's bowels (yuck).

art.

	Clip art: little pictures of coffee cups, musical notes, flags, and such that are in the public domain--so anyone can use them. Lots of wordprocessing programs have this. Pop Art stands for Popular Art. (like Andy Warhol's soup cans).

hair.

	They used to use horsehair for upholstery. Someone wearing a hair shirt is paying penance--anyone know the origin of that expression?

basket.

	When my sister and I were little, we used to take all the candy eggs out of our Easter baskets and make 'parades' out of them--on the floor, I think (makes for nice clean candy eggs).

pillow.

	Throw pillows are those little ones people have on couches and beds. I guess pillow talk is in-bed chatting.

point & bat.

	I take your point!

paper.

	We used to wrap our sandwiches in waxed paper before baggies were invented. A paper tiger is someone who seems scary but isn't an actual threat.

book.

	Book cover, address book, book club, and so on.

head.

	A Dead Head is a Grateful Dead fan. Gardeners sometimes deadhead flowering plants by cutting or plucking off the dead blooms.

cat.

	Catfish, catsup, cat box, Siamese cat, and so on. A cat burglar is one who's really lithe and sneaky, I guess.

button & water.

	A hot button issue is one that stirs people up. A button hook was used to help button up old-fashioned button boots.

clip.

	A clip joint is an establishment where customers get ripped off.

frog.

	A bullfrog has a very deep voice. A frogman is a skin diver.

cloth.

	Loin cloths are worn on the hips, or loins. Before Pampers we used to use cloth diapers.

bowl.

	The bowl games are the Super Bowl, the Sugar Bowl, the Rose Bowl, the Cotton Bowl, the Hula Bowl, and the Orange Bowl. Did I miss any? I assume there's no Toilet Bowl.
